DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Dimensionality Axial Sagittal Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the method, dimensionality and plane used in magnetic resonance imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (mag-NET-ik REZ-o-nans IM-a-jing) MRI. A procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body.  Also called nuclear magnetic resonance imaging.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Changed long name to match EVS Preferred Name DW

Property.preferredDefinition: The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

Concepts.definition: The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Axial Or Sagittal Plane Postcontrast, 3-dimensional, Isotropic, IR-prepped T1-weighted Gradient Echo MRI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Axial Or Sagittal Plane Postcontrast, 3-dimensional, Isotropic, IR-prepped T1-weighted Gradient Echo MRI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Pertaining to a plane containing a line parallel to the long axis of the subject's body, and additionally giving a left or right view. This plane is perpendicular to both the transaxial and coronal planes.: 3-dimensional, T1-weighted magnetic resonance imaging that uses gradient-echo acquisition with inversion recovery, done after injection of a contrast agent.

Concepts.definition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Pertaining to a plane containing a line parallel to the long axis of the subject's body, and additionally giving a left or right view. This plane is perpendicular to both the transaxial and coronal planes.

Concepts.longName: Postcontrast, 3-dimensional, Isotropic, IR-prepped T1-weighted Gradient Echo MRI
Concepts.definition: 3-dimensional, T1-weighted magnetic resonance imaging that uses gradient-echo acquisition with inversion recovery, done after injection of a contrast agent.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Axial 2-dimensional T2-weighted MRI Or 2-dimensional Proton Density, T2-weighted MRI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Axial 2-dimensional T2-weighted MRI Or 2-dimensional Proton Density, T2-weighted MRI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.: 2-dimensional magnetic resonance imaging that highlights differences in the T2 relaxation time of tissues.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: 2-dimensional magnetic resonance imaging that uses proton density weighting and T2 weighting to suppress the signal from fatty tissues.

Concepts.definition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.
2-dimensional magnetic resonance imaging that highlights differences in the T2 relaxation time of tissues.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
2-dimensional magnetic resonance imaging that uses proton density weighting and T2 weighting to suppress the signal from fatty tissues.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Axial 2-dimensional, Diffusion-weighted Imaging/ Diffusion Tensor Imaging

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Axial 2-dimensional, Diffusion-weighted Imaging/ Diffusion Tensor Imaging
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.: 2-dimension, T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging that uses the diffusion of water molecules to generate contrast in MR images. Diffusion tensor imaging (DTI), a specific type of DWI, can be used to map white matter tractography in the brain.

Concepts.definition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.

2-dimension, T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging that uses the diffusion of water molecules to generate contrast in MR images. Diffusion tensor imaging (DTI), a specific type of DWI, can be used to map white matter tractography in the brain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.: 2-dimensional magnetic resonance imaging that uses an inversion recovery set to null fluids.

Concepts.definition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.
2-dimensional magnetic resonance imaging that uses an inversion recovery set to null fluids.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Axial Or Sagittal Plane Precontrast, 3-dimensional, Isotropic, IR-prepped T1-weighted Gradient Echo MRI

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Axial Or Sagittal Plane Precontrast, 3-dimensional, Isotropic, IR-prepped T1-weighted Gradient Echo MRI
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Pertaining to a plane containing a line parallel to the long axis of the subject's body, and additionally giving a left or right view. This plane is perpendicular to both the transaxial and coronal planes.: 3-dimensional, T1-weighted magnetic resonance imaging that uses gradient-echo acquisition with inversion recovery, in the absence of a contrast agent.

Concepts.definition: Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Pertaining to a plane containing a line parallel to the long axis of the subject's body, and additionally giving a left or right view. This plane is perpendicular to both the transaxial and coronal planes.

Concepts.longName: Precontrast, 3-dimensional, Isotropic, IR-prepped T1-weighted Gradient Echo MRI
Concepts.definition: 3-dimensional, T1-weighted magnetic resonance imaging that uses gradient-echo acquisition with inversion recovery, in the absence of a contrast agent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
